body_html: @mholt - If you're using the NGC image for TensorFlow, you don't actually need to install cuDNN directly, as it's installed in the container for you already. The NGC frameworks release 17.12 includes cuDNN 7.0.5 and should fix this issue. Or are you saying you tried 17.12 and still see an issue?
body_text: @mholt - If you're using the NGC image for TensorFlow, you don't actually need to install cuDNN directly, as it's installed in the container for you already.  The NGC frameworks release 17.12 includes cuDNN 7.0.5 and should fix this issue.  Or are you saying you tried 17.12 and still see an issue?
body: @mholt - If you're using the NGC image for TensorFlow, you don't actually need to install cuDNN directly, as it's installed in the container for you already.  The NGC frameworks release 17.12 includes cuDNN 7.0.5 and should fix this issue.  Or are you saying you tried 17.12 and still see an issue?
